column7: Northern Star is a global-scale Australian gold producer with world-class projects located in Australia and North America's highly prospective and low sovereign risk regions.\t

column6: Entities included in the organization's sustainability reporting
column7: The entities included are Kalgoorlie Production Centre, Pogo Production Centre, Yandal Production Centre and Exploration Centre.

column6: Reporting period, frequency, and contact point
column7: This Sustainability Report provides information on Northern Star's sustainability performance across its Operations from 1 July 2022 to 30 June 2023.

Jundee Scope 1 Emissions were overstated by 63 t CO2-e in the FY22 Sustainability Report, KCGM Scope 2 Emissions were overstated by 33,000 t CO2-e in the FY22 Sustainability Report, Electricity generation for Porphyry was incorrectly reported in FY22 and has been removed in this report, Total tonnes of material recycled in FY22 was overstated by 21, FY21 net total water consumption up from 17,757 ML to 18,200 ML and our total freshwater consumption up from 1,666 ML to 2,110 ML, Total funds committed to Community Investment and Sponsorships was understated in the FY22 Sustainability Report by $0.64M, Revenue for FY22 (refer to Table 1) has been restated from $3,735M to $3,806M.
Management has sought independent, third-party assurance by Bureau Veritas Australia Pty.

column6: Activities, value chain and other business relationships
column7: Northern Star is a global-scale Australian gold producer with world-class projects located in highly prospective and low sovereign risk regions of Australia and North America.
The group's total number of employees in FY23 was 3,587.
Workers who are not employees consist of contractors and apprentices.
The group governance structure consists of audit and risk, ESS, E&G, Nomination, People and culture.

column6: Nomination and selection of the highest governance body
column7: The nomination and selection of the highest governance body at Northern Star is a critical process overseen by the Nomination Committee.

column6: Chair of the highest governance body
column7: Mr Chaney AO is the chairman for the current reporting period.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in overseeing the management of impacts
column7: Northern Star's approach is to create sustainable and profitable value for our shareholders and other stakeholders through ongoing review and improvement of our environmental, social and governance performance.

column6: Delegation of responsibility for managing impacts
column7: The Board plays an essential role in establishing and maintaining the Company's corporate governance standards, including determining the Company's values and policies and ensuring they are applied consistently, setting the Company's strategic objectives, supervising management and timely and accurate reporting to shareholders.

column6: Role of the highest governance body in sustainability reporting
column7: Northern Star's approach is to create sustainable and profitable value for our shareholders and other stakeholders through ongoing review and improvement of our environmental, social and governance performance.

column13: The Code of Conduct at Northern Star is a set of guidelines and principles that define the standards of behaviour and ethics expected from all members of our organisation. It serves as a compass for our employees, ensuring they conduct themselves with integrity, respect, and professionalism in all their interactions, both within the company and with external stakeholders.

column13: The External Complaints and Grievances process at Northern Star represents a structured approach to handling concerns, issues, or complaints raised by individuals or entities outside our organisation. These matters are treated with the utmost seriousness, and we are dedicated to offering a fair and transparent mechanism for addressing external feedback.

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column13: Board Skills Assessment at Northern Star systematically evaluates the competencies, qualifications, and expertise of our board members. This process ensures that our board comprises individuals with diverse skills and experiences that align with our strategic goals and corporate governance needs.

column6: Collective knowledge of the highest governance body
column13: The Annual Board Skills Matrix at Northern Star is a comprehensive assessment tool used to evaluate and document our board members' skills, qualifications, and expertise. This matrix is updated annually to ensure that our board composition aligns with our strategic objectives and corporate governance requirements.
column20: Annual Board skills matrix, potential emerging gap, appropriate input

column6: Evaluation of the performance of the highest governance body
column13: Board performance evaluation at Northern Star is a structured process used to assess and improve the effectiveness of our board of directors. This evaluation includes feedback from board members themselves, as well as input from various stakeholders.
column20: Board performance evaluation, governance, Director performance evaluations.

column13: The Key Management Personnel (KMP) Remuneration Policy at Northern Star outlines the principles and guidelines governing the compensation and benefits for our top executives and key management personnel. This policy ensures that remuneration is competitive, performance-based, and aligned with the company's strategic goals.

column7: Determining remuneration through a long and short-term incentive plan is the group process.

column13: The Human Resources Information System (HRIS) at Northern Star is a digital platform that serves as a centralised hub for managing and organising all HR-related data and processes within our organisation. It streamlines employee records, payroll, recruitment, and performance management functions.

column13: The Stakeholder Policy at Northern Star outlines our approach to engaging with and managing relationships with various stakeholders, including employees, investors, communities, and partners. column6: Mechanisms for seeking advice and raising concern
column13: The Concerns Procedure at Northern Star is a structured framework for addressing and resolving employee, stakeholder, or partner issues or complaints. It provides a clear and accessible process for reporting concerns and ensures that they are thoroughly investigated and addressed fairly and on time.

column7: FY23, the group has zero materiality adverse accidents.

Northern Star is a member of The Chamber of Minerals and Energy of Western Australia, The Association of Mining and Exploration Companies, The Chamber of Commerce and Industry WA, The Gold Industry Group, The Alaska Miners Association, The Council of Alaska Producers, and The National Mining Association.
